title: Avenir Next
content:
**[Indicies](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indicies) : [Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typefaces) : Avenir Next**

Avenir Next was designed by [Adrian Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Adrian%20Frutiger) and [Akira Kobayashi](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Akira%20Kobayashi), and released by [Linotype Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Linotype%20Library) in 2004. The type family is a complete revision of Frutiger's [Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Avenir) (1988), and is part of [Linotype Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Linotype%20Library)'s [Platinum Collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Platinum%20Collection).

Adrian Frutiger designed the original [Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Avenir) for Linotype in 1988. It is based on an amalgamation of [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Futura) and [Erbar](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Erbar). Frutiger had never been happy with the cold, modern appearance of Futura, so he "humanized" it.

Avenir Next has a better distribution of weight across the family than Avenir did. The fonts also have small caps and old style figures in them. Each weight also has a condensed variant. No true [italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/italic) styles were made though, just [oblique](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123082747/http:/typophile.com/wiki/oblique) ones. This seems in keeping with most of Frutiger's other typefaces.
